text: ਇਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਜਾਟਰੋ ਉਠਿ ਭਗਤੀ ਲਾਗਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Hearing this, Dhanna the Jaat applied himself to devotional worship.

transliteration.text: ih bidh sun kai jātarō uth bhagatī lāgā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਮਿਲੇ ਪ੍ਰਤਖਿ ਗੁਸਾਈਆ ਧੰਨਾ ਵਡਭਾਗਾ ॥੪॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord of the Universe met him personally; Dhanna was so very blessed. ||4||2||

transliteration.text: milē pratakh gusāīā dhannā vadabhāgā .4.2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਰੇ ਚਿਤ ਚੇਤਸਿ ਕੀ ਨ ਦਯਾਲ ਦਮੋਦਰ ਬਿਬਹਿ ਨ ਜਾਨਸਿ ਕੋਈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O my consciousness, why don't you remain conscious of the Merciful Lord? How can you recognize any other?

transliteration.text: rē chit chētas kī n dayāl damōdar bibah n jānas kōī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਜੇ ਧਾਵਹਿ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੰਡ ਖੰਡ ਕਉ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਰੈ ਸੁ ਹੋਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You may run around the whole universe, but that alone happens which the Creator Lord does. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jē dhāvah brahamand khand kau karatā karai s hōī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਜਨਨੀ ਕੇਰੇ ਉਦਰ ਉਦਕ ਮਹਿ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਕੀਆ ਦਸ ਦੁਆਰਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the water of the mother's womb, He fashioned the body with ten gates.

transliteration.text: jananī kērē udar udak mah pind kīā das duārā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਦੇਇ ਅਹਾਰੁ ਅਗਨਿ ਮਹਿ ਰਾਖੈ ਐਸਾ ਖਸਮੁ ਹਮਾਰਾ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He gives it sustenance, and preserves it in fire - such is my Lord and Master. ||1||

transliteration.text: dēi ahār agan mah rākhai aisā khasam hamārā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਕੁੰਮੀ ਜਲ ਮਾਹਿ ਤਨ ਤਿਸੁ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਪੰਖ ਖੀਰੁ ਤਿਨ ਨਾਹੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The mother turtle is in the water, and her babies are out of the water. She has no wings to protect them, and no milk to feed them.

transliteration.text: kunmī jal māh tan tis bāhar pankh khīr tin nāhī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਮਾਨੰਦ ਮਨੋਹਰ ਸਮਝਿ ਦੇਖੁ ਮਨ ਮਾਹੀ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Perfect Lord, the embodiment of supreme bliss, the Fascinating Lord takes care of them. See this, and understand it in your mind||2||

transliteration.text: pūran paramānand manōhar samajh dēkh man māhī .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਪਾਖਣਿ ਕੀਟੁ ਗੁਪਤੁ ਹੋਇ ਰਹਤਾ ਤਾ ਚੋ ਮਾਰਗੁ ਨਾਹੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The worm lies hidden under the stone - there is no way for him to escape.

transliteration.text: pākhan kīt gupat hōi rahatā tā chō mārag nāhī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਕਹੈ ਧੰਨਾ ਪੂਰਨ ਤਾਹੂ ਕੋ ਮਤ ਰੇ ਜੀਅ ਡਰਾਂਹੀ ॥੩॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Dhanna, the Perfect Lord takes care of him. Fear not, O my soul. ||3||3||

transliteration.text: kahai dhannā pūran tāhū kō mat rē jī darānhhī .3.3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Dhana
author.description:
Saint Dhana [1415 - 1475], whose three hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib, was born to a poor Hindu farmer family of Jat caste in the village of Dhuan Kalan located in the Tonk region of Rajasthan. From his very childhood, Saint Dhana was very simple, hardworking and innocent. He enjoyed being in the company of saints and scholars and soon became a follower of the famous Saint Ramanand.

It is written that Saint Dhana asked a Brahmin about God who gave him a stone to worship. Dhana offered food and milk to the stone, and refused to eat till God accepted his food. Through this innocent love and pure devotion, God appeared before him and the fields Dhana was going to plow with seeds, began to produce grains without them.

text: ਆਸਾ ਸੇਖ ਫਰੀਦ ਜੀਉ ਕੀ ਬਾਣੀ
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Aasaa, The Word Of Shaykh Fareed Jee:

transliteration.text: āsā sēkh pharīd jīu kī bānī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਦਿਲਹੁ ਮੁਹਬਤਿ ਜਿੰਨ੍ਹ ਸੇਈ ਸਚਿਆ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: They alone are true, whose love for God is deep and heart-felt.

transliteration.text: dilah muhabat jinnh sēī sachiā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

Saint Sheikh Farid met Guru Nanak Dev in Pakpattan, where a disciple of the Sheikh had overheard Guru Nanak, along with his two disciples Bhai Bala and Mardana, singing hymns about God. The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹ ਮਨਿ ਹੋਰੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਹੋਰੁ ਸਿ ਕਾਂਢੇ ਕਚਿਆ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who have one thing in their heart, and something else in their mouth, are judged to be false. ||1||

transliteration.text: jinh man hōr mukh hōr s kānhdhē kachiā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਰਤੇ ਇਸਕ ਖੁਦਾਇ ਰੰਗਿ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਕੇ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who are imbued with love for the Lord, are delighted by His Vision.

transliteration.text: ratē isak khudāi rang dīdār kē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who forget the Naam, the Name of the Lord, are a burden on the earth. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: visariā jinh nām tē bhui bhār thīē .1. rahāu .

text: ਆਪਿ ਲੀਏ ਲੜਿ ਲਾਇ ਦਰਿ ਦਰਵੇਸ ਸੇ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those whom the Lord attaches to the hem of His robe, are the true dervishes at His Door.

transliteration.text: āp līē lar lāi dar daravēs sē .

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Blessed are the mothers who gave birth to them, and fruitful is their coming into the world. ||2||

transliteration.text: tin dhann janēdī māu āē saphal sē .2.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord, Sustainer and Cherisher, You are infinite, unfathomable and endless.

transliteration.text: paravadagār apār agam bēant tū .

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who recognize the True Lord - I kiss their feet. ||3||

transliteration.text: jinā pashātā sach chunmā pair mūn .3.

text: ਤੇਰੀ ਪਨਹ ਖੁਦਾਇ ਤੂ ਬਖਸੰਦਗੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I seek Your Protection - You are the Forgiving Lord.

transliteration.text: tērī panah khudāi tū bakhasandagī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

text: ਸੇਖ ਫਰੀਦੈ ਖੈਰੁ ਦੀਜੈ ਬੰਦਗੀ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Please, bless Shaykh Fareed with the bounty of Your meditative worship. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: sēkh pharīdai khair dījai bandagī .4.1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid

text: ਆਸਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Aasaa:

transliteration.text: āsā .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਬੋਲੈ ਸੇਖ ਫਰੀਦੁ ਪਿਆਰੇ ਅਲਹ ਲਗੇ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Shaykh Fareed, O my dear friend, attach yourself to the Lord.

transliteration.text: bōlai sēkh pharīd piārē alah lagē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਇਹੁ ਤਨੁ ਹੋਸੀ ਖਾਕ ਨਿਮਾਣੀ ਗੋਰ ਘਰੇ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This body shall turn to dust, and its home shall be a neglected graveyard. ||1||

transliteration.text: ih tan hōsī khāk nimānī gōr gharē .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:

text: ਆਜੁ ਮਿਲਾਵਾ ਸੇਖ ਫਰੀਦ ਟਾਕਿਮ ਕੂੰਜੜੀਆ ਮਨਹੁ ਮਚਿੰਦੜੀਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You can meet the Lord today, O Shaykh Fareed, if you restrain your bird-like desires which keep your mind in turmoil. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: āj milāvā sēkh pharīd tākim kūnjarīā manah machindarīā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਜੇ ਜਾਣਾ ਮਰਿ ਜਾਈਐ ਘੁਮਿ ਨ ਆਈਐ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If I had known that I was to die, and not return again,

transliteration.text: jē jānā mar jāīai ghum n āīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:

text: ਝੂਠੀ ਦੁਨੀਆ ਲਗਿ ਨ ਆਪੁ ਵਞਾਈਐ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I would not have ruined myself by clinging to the world of falsehood. ||2||

transliteration.text: jhūthī dunīā lag n āp vañāīai .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

text: ਬੋਲੀਐ ਸਚੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਝੂਠੁ ਨ ਬੋਲੀਐ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: So speak the Truth, in righteousness, and do not speak falsehood.

transliteration.text: bōlīai sach dharam jhūth n bōlīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

text: ਜੋ ਗੁਰੁ ਦਸੈ ਵਾਟ ਮੁਰੀਦਾ ਜੋਲੀਐ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The disciple ought to travel the route, pointed out by the Guru. ||3||

transliteration.text: jō gur dasai vāt murīdā jōlīai .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:

text: ਛੈਲ ਲੰਘੰਦੇ ਪਾਰਿ ਗੋਰੀ ਮਨੁ ਧੀਰਿਆ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Seeing the youths being carried across, the hearts of the beautiful young soul-brides are encouraged.

transliteration.text: shail langhandē pār gōrī man dhīriā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:

text: ਕੰਚਨ ਵੰਨੇ ਪਾਸੇ ਕਲਵਤਿ ਚੀਰਿਆ ॥੪॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who side with the glitter of gold, are cut down with a saw. ||4||

transliteration.text: kanchan vannē pāsē kalavat chīriā .4.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:

text: ਸੇਖ ਹੈਯਾਤੀ ਜਗਿ ਨ ਕੋਈ ਥਿਰੁ ਰਹਿਆ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Shaykh, no one's life is permanent in this world.

transliteration.text: sēkh haiyātī jag n kōī thir rahiā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:

text: ਜਿਸੁ ਆਸਣਿ ਹਮ ਬੈਠੇ ਕੇਤੇ ਬੈਸਿ ਗਇਆ ॥੫॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: That seat, upon which we now sit - many others sat on it and have since departed. ||5||

transliteration.text: jis āsan ham baithē kētē bais gaiā .5.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਕਤਿਕ ਕੂੰਜਾਂ ਚੇਤਿ ਡਉ ਸਾਵਣਿ ਬਿਜੁਲੀਆਂ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As the swallows appear in the month of Katik, forest fires in the month of Chayt, and lightning in Saawan,

transliteration.text: katik kūnjānh chēt dau sāvan bijulīānh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਸੀਆਲੇ ਸੋਹੰਦੀਆਂ ਪਿਰ ਗਲਿ ਬਾਹੜੀਆਂ ॥੬॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: and as the bride's arms adorn her husband's neck in winter;||6||

transliteration.text: sīālē sōhandīānh pir gal bāharīānh .6.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਚਲੇ ਚਲਣਹਾਰ ਵਿਚਾਰਾ ਲੇਇ ਮਨੋ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Just so, the transitory human bodies pass away. Reflect upon this in your mind.

transliteration.text: chalē chalanahār vichārā lēi manō .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਗੰਢੇਦਿਆਂ ਛਿਅ ਮਾਹ ਤੁੜੰਦਿਆ ਹਿਕੁ ਖਿਨੋ ॥੭॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: It takes six months to form the body, but it breaks in an instant. ||7||

transliteration.text: gandhēdiānh shi māh turandiā hik khinō .7.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਜਿਮੀ ਪੁਛੈ ਅਸਮਾਨ ਫਰੀਦਾ ਖੇਵਟ ਕਿੰਨਿ ਗਏ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Fareed, the earth asks the sky, "Where have the boatmen gone?"

transliteration.text: jimī pushai asamān pharīdā khēvat kinn gaē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Sheikh Farid
author.description:
Saint Sheikh Farid [? - 1552], also known as Baba Farid, Sheikh Brahm or Farid Sani, was the tenth successor to the famous Fariduddin Shakarganj [1173 - 1266], a Muslim Sufi of the Chishti Sufi order who was the first major poet of the Punjabi language.

Saint Sheikh Farid met Guru Nanak Dev in Pakpattan, where a disciple of the Sheikh had overheard Guru Nanak, along with his two disciples Bhai Bala and Mardana, singing hymns about God. The disciple went to his master, Saint Sheikh Farid, and at once upon hearing the hymn from his disciple he set off to meet Guru Nanak himself, which gave him the peace and joy he was looking for.

text: ਜਾਲਣ ਗੋਰਾਂ ਨਾਲਿ ਉਲਾਮੇ ਜੀਅ ਸਹੇ ॥੮॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Some have been cremated, and some lie in their graves; their souls are suffering rebukes. ||8||2||

transliteration.text: jālan gōrānh nāl ulāmē jī sahē .8.2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

Saint Sheikh Farid met Guru Nanak Dev in Pakpattan, where a disciple of the Sheikh had overheard Guru Nanak, along with his two disciples Bhai Bala and Mardana, singing hymns about God.
